skills.name: Identify the factors of a term

explanations.A: Not quite. A coefficient is a number or constant quantity placed before and multiplying a variable (letter) or term in an algebraic expression. As the 3 (a number) is multiplying 洧논 (a variable) it is a coefficient. Is there a number in this expression that is not multiplying a variable or term?
explanations.B: Not quite. A coefficient is a number or constant quantity placed before and multiplying a variable (letter) or term in an algebraic expression. As the 4 (a number) is multiplying y (a variable) it is a coefficient. Is there a number in this expression that is not multiplying a variable or term?
explanations.C: I think you thought that 洧논y had no coefficient, or 0 as a coefficient. But remember, a coefficient is a number or constant quantity placed before and multiplying a variable (letter) or term in an algebraic expression. As xy can be written as 1 x 洧논 x y, 1 must be the coefficient of this term. Is there a number in this expression that is not multiplying a variable or term?
explanations.D: A coefficient is a number or constant quantity placed before and multiplying a variable (letter) or term in an algebraic expression. As 7 is not multiplying a variable (letter) or term it is a constant as opposed to a coefficient.

explanations.A: Not quite. A coefficient is a number or constant quantity placed before and multiplying a variable (letter) or term in an algebraic expression. As the 7 (a number) is multiplying p (a variable) it is a coefficient. Is there a number in this expression that is not multiplying a variable or term?
explanations.B: Not quite. Look closely at the second term. t is being multiplied by -4, therefore -4 is the coefficient of this term. Which option is not a coefficient? Is there a number in this expression that is not multiplying a variable or term?
explanations.C: I think you thought that tq had no coefficient, or 0 as a coefficient. But remember, a coefficient is a number or constant quantity placed before and multiplying a variable (letter) or term in an algebraic expression. As tq can be written as 1 x t x q, 1 must be the coefficient of this term. Is there a number in this expression that is not multiplying a variable or term?
explanations.D: A coefficient is a number or constant quantity placed before and multiplying a variable (letter) or term in an algebraic expression. As 4 is not multiplying a variable (letter) or term it is a constant as opposed to a coefficient.

explanations.A: I think you counted all the numbers and variables (letters) you can see in the expression, but these are not all terms. A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. As the 7 and 洧논 are multiplying, 7洧논 would be considered one term.
explanations.B: Not quite. There is one expression but this expression can be divided into terms. Remember, a term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. Operations, such as addition and subtraction, combine terms to form expressions.
explanations.C: A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. As the 7 and 洧논 are multiplying, 7洧논 would be considered one term. As 2, 洧논 and y are multiplying this would be considered another term. The -5 is a constant term. Therefore, this expression has three terms altogether.
explanations.D: I think you thought terms have to have a varaiable (letter) in them. But numbers are considered constant terms.

explanations.A: A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. As the 4 and t are multiplying, 4t would be considered one term. As 3 and r are multiplying, 3r would be considered a term. Similarly ,-7r is a term as -7 and r are multiplying. The 8 is a constant which is also considered a term, therefore this expression has 4 terms altogether.
explanations.B: I think you counted all the numbers and variables (letters) you can see in the expression, but these are not all terms. A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. As the 4 and t are multiplying, 4t would be considered one term.
explanations.C: I think you thought terms have to have a varaiable (letter) in them. But numbers are considered constant terms.
explanations.D: Not quite. There is one expression but this expression can be divided into terms. Remember, a term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. Operations, such as addition and subtraction, combine terms to form expressions.

explanations.A: A factor is a number or variable that is part of a product (multiplication). The term (1/2)bh can be written as 1/2 x b x h, which shows that this term has three factors 1/2, b and h.
explanations.B: I think you thought that a factor has to be a variable (letter), but algebraic terms can also have numerical factors. Rewriting this term using multiplication signs can help you identify how many factors a term has.
explanations.C: I think you have confused some of the terminology here. A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together where as a factor is a number or variable that is part of a product (multiplication). 1/2bh is considered one term, how many factors does it have?
explanations.D: Not quite, be careful with your definitions. A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together where as a factor is a number or variable that is part of a product (multiplication). 1/2bh is considered one term, how many factors does it have? Remember algebraic terms can have numerical factors.

explanations.A: I think you thought that a factor has to be a variable (letter), but algebraic terms can also have numerical factors. Rewriting this term using multiplication signs can help you identify how many factors a term has.
explanations.B: I think you have confused some of the terminology here. A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together where as a factor is a number or variable that is part of a product (multiplication). 1/3lwh is considered one term, how many factors does it have?
explanations.C: A factor is a number or variable that is part of a product (multiplication). The term (1/3)lwh can be written as 1/3 x l x w x h, which shows that this term has four factors 1/3, l, w and h.
explanations.D: Not quite, be careful with your definitions. A term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together where as a factor is a number or variable that is part of a product (multiplication). 1/3lwh is considered one term, how many factors does it have? Remember algebraic terms can have numerical factors.

explanations.A: Not quite. 2 is a factor of 6 therefore 2 will be also be a factor of 6b. We are being asked which option is NOT a factor of 6b. Listing factor pairs of 6b will help you identify which option is NOT a factor.
explanations.B: Dividing 6b by b gives 6 with no remainder. Therefore b is a factor of 6b. We are being asked which option is NOT a factor of 6b. Listing factor pairs of 6b will help you identify which option is NOT a factor.
explanations.C: Dividing 6 by 4 gives 1 remainder 2. As 6 is not divisible by 4, 4 is not a factor of 6. As 4 is not a factor of 6, it will not be a factor of 6b.
explanations.D: Dividing 6b by 3b gives 2 with no remainder. Therefore 3b is a factor of 6b. We are being asked which option is NOT a factor of 6b. Listing factor pairs of 6b will help you identify which option is NOT a factor.

explanations.A: Dividing 12 by 9 gives 1 remainder 3. As 12 is not divisible by 9, 9 is not a factor of 12. As 9 is not a factor of 12, it will not be a factor of 12a.
explanations.B: Dividing 12a by a gives 12 with no remainder. Therefore a is a factor of 12a. We are being asked which option is NOT a factor of 12a. Listing factor pairs of 12a will help you identify which option is NOT a factor.
explanations.C: Not quite. 3 is a factor of 12 therefore 3 will be also be a factor of 12a. We are being asked which option is NOT a factor of 12a. Listing factor pairs of 12a will help you identify which option is NOT a factor.
explanations.D: Dividing 12a by 4a gives 3 with no remainder. Therefore 4a is a factor of 12a. We are being asked which option is NOT a factor of 6b. Listing factor pairs of 12a will help you identify which option is NOT a factor.

explanations.A: The expression 5(2a + b) can be written as 5 x (2a + b), therefore it is a product (multiplication) of two factors 5 and (2a + b) so Tom is correct. The expression (2a + b) on its own is a sum (addition) with two terms, 2a and b, therefore Katie is incorrect
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember a term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. This means 2a is one term and not two. Also, product means multiply. How many factors are being multiplied together to give the term 5(2a + b)?
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember a term is a number, variable or a combination of numbers and variables multiplied together. This means 2a is one term and not two.
explanations.D: Not quite, at least one of the students is correct. If an expression is the product of two factors then it can be written as the multiplication of two individual parts. Is this the case with 5(2a + b)? And if an expression is the sum of three terms, then there must be three individual terms being added together. Is this true for (2a + b)?

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember a factor is a number or variable that is part of a product (multiplication). How many factors are being multiplied together to give the term 4(洧논 + y)? Thinking about where the multiplication signs will go can help you determine how many factors an expression has.
explanations.B: The expression 4(洧논 + y) can be written as 4 x (洧논 + y), therefore it is a product (multiplication) of two factors 4 and (洧논 + y) so Tom is incorrect. The expression (洧논 + y) on its own is a sum (addition) with two terms, 洧논 and y, therefore Katie is correct
explanations.C: Not quite, at least one of the students is incorrect. If an expression is the product of three factors then it can be written as the multiplication of three individual parts. Is this the case with 4(洧논 + y)? And if an expression is the sum of two terms, then there must be two individual terms being added together. Is this true for (洧논 + y)?
explanations.D: Not quite, at least one of the students is correct. If an expression is the product of three factors then it can be written as the multiplication of three individual parts. Is this the case with 4(洧논 + y)? And if an expression is the sum of two terms, then there must be two individual terms being added together. Is this true for (洧논 + y)?
